page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.
page.content: This is a very rural part of south Warwickshire,lying almost in the centre of a triangle,with the relatively prosperous towns of Stratford-On-Avon,Royal Leamington Spa, and Banbury at each corner.The fertile agricultural land is mainly used for arable farming,although some pastural farming is evident.Two features bisect the area, one natural and one man made.The river Dene north west to east through the block,and along its course is to be found Walton wood and other wooded areas, mainly of a deciduous nature.The Fossway, the famous Roman road,runs north to south west and even today is the main transport route of note,despite the B4451,which runs through Butlers Marston..
